A regular haunt
reviews.text: Great value restaurant, especially the Sunday carvery. Friendly staff. It is advisable to book. Worth crossing the road and taking the view from the cliffs.
We went as a group of four for lunch. Nice location, fairly smart interior, pleasant staff, but food poor to average.
reviews.title: Not as good as it thinks it is
Good value, good beer.
reviews.text: My salad nicoise was the worst of the meals. I've never had one without anchovies before - perhaps the chef could try looking at the first ten recipes on Google. The 'dressing' appeared to be the water in which the salad had been washed. The tuna was reasonable, but the egg was poached and soft whereas most recipes say it should a quartered hard-boiled egg.

reviews.title: The price was a pleasant surprise
reviews.text: The lady who had the fishcakes described them as being mostly potato with very little fish, and the accompanying peas appeared to be straight out of a tin.

We are locals who have eaten here before a few times but in time this place has gone down hill. This is often the destination for people who can't get a table at the nearby 'cliff restaurant'. We don't expect outstanding food but the burgers we had (we ordered 8 burgers in terrible) were awful. The burger meat was as cheap as it gets. This place could be fantastic. Such a nice local area and the pub and the interior and exterior is fabulous, but the food is very very poor. The table service wasn't great but we didn't mind as only went for pub grub, but I would be embarrassed if I had taken my friends into the inside restaurant.
reviews.title: Awful burgers.......

reviews.text: I didn;t even realise that the Beehive had "re-opened" in a new location (the old Orton Rigg old peoples home). Hence I was quite excited by the prospect of going somewhere new to me. The interior decoration was nicely done but there was a terrible looking stain on the carpet. I'm not sure what it was but the vibe of the place wasn't quite right. Not sure whether it was because it felt like a place that used to be an old people's home, the music which didn't sound right because of the choice and acoustics, or the older rather pedestrian landlady type person serving behind the bar. The menu offering is limited and very uninspiring (as if taken from a pub twenty years ago). There is a complete absence of any kind of local produce being put on offer. You rarely see that these days in any successful pub offering food.
reviews.title: It's a pub....and that's about it.

reviews.text: The pretty Eastern European waiting staff were very helpful and the food came out pretty quick. My burger was actually much tastier then appearances suggested. The beer garden was a nice place to be but had some rather old school sit and ride amusements and an old shooting arcade game which seemed a little out of place as against the rather chic interior. It's a place that doesn't seem to know what it wants to be. I know many pubs work an angle to differentiate their offering from other pubs in the area. The New Beehive does not do this. The fatal blow is having "The Cliff" pub right next door. The Cliff has a far better menu, is busier and hence has more of a "buzz" about it and seems to get things better in their execution of the offering from comfy and smart interior, to table lay out and the finer details. The New Beehive still uses the little annoying condiments sachets which appear to dispense about a thimble full of product (meaning you have to open 3/4 of them to get a reasonable amount (why do they make them so small? It's infuriating).
reviews.title: sunday carver

reviews.text: We had to ask our server to bring us salt and pepper. I asked for mayonaise to go with my chips and we were dropped a mixed bowl of sachets which was missing.... guess what? Yes, no mayonnaise. Bit silly really and it was easily sorted but this goes to my point about execution and details.
reviews.title: No a great experience

reviews.text: Despite this the whole visit seemed to drip with mediocrity. Its a shame because there clearly has been some thought go into the interior but everything else comes from a pub operating 20 years ago.
reviews.title: New Beehive has gone downhill

reviews.text: Average food. Nothing special. A little bit pretentious. On the plus side the location is quite good. Do give it a try if you are in the area as I think they are making an effort to please. Just the food is very ordinary. Something lacking.
reviews.title: underwhelmed

reviews.text: Have not stayed but went here for lunch today. Lovely food, great menu choices, staff very friendly and the Lemon Cream Dream for dessert was delicious. Definitely recommend and will go again :-)
reviews.title: Love their food!
Can t beat the carvery
reviews.text: I have never stayed here as I live locally, but we have eaten here several times on a Sunday, and the carvery is the best in the area, besides the choice of two meats, they do a pie as well, which is delicious. The vegetables are always cooked beautifully, I can t wait to visit again!
